intro: Calcitrapa conferta, commonly known as the common thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its name derives from the shape of its fruit, which resembles a thimble. Calcitrapa conferta is often used in herbal medicine for its purported sedative and antispasmodic properties.
